f29.t1.1: It’s time for patients to take control of their health, through their data, to work alongside their doctors and drive research
f29.t1.2: At Foundation 29 we work with all those who share this vision creating the necessary tools and initiatives to achieve it
f29.t2.3: Tools that unleash the power of collaboration around data
f29.t2.4.1.1: The power to drive the diagnosis
f29.t2.4.1.2: Help diagnosis for doctors and patients
f29.t2.4.1.3: Dx29 is a free application that allows patients and doctors to speed up the rare disease diagnosis process.
f29.t2.4.1.4: We apply artificial intelligence to help patients and professionals identify symptoms and predict accurate diagnoses.
f29.t2.4.2.1: The power to share the knowledge
f29.t2.4.2.3: HealthData29 makes it easy to share health data sets with researchers for use in medical research in a simple and secure way.
f29.t2.4.2.4: The initiative includes a guide to good practices in the sharing and processing of this data and has been awarded by the Spanish Agency for Data Protection.
f29.t2.4.3.3: Patient data are critical for research. Help to develop new treatments and improve research without leaving home. Raito is your personal health data container.
f29.t3.1.3: An NGO of doers, not talkers, fighting hard for a real change
f29.t3.2.3: Open standard activists, data-driven scientists, patient-empowering advocates, enabling-technology creators and healthcare system changemakers.
f29.t3.3.2: from the patient, with the patient and for the patient
f29.t3.4.2: a new medicine model around patients
f29.t3.4.3: Working with their physicians for their health and the health of others in an ecosystem that openly shares its data to advance medical knowledge together.
f29.t4.1: We are a non-profit foundation. We work for a medicine in which empowered patients take control of their health through their data and work with doctors and institutions to improve their well-being and that of others.
f29.t4.2: We create technologies that allow a radical change in your capabilities as users and in the entire medical ecosystem.
f29.t4.3: The activism of patients, their families and associations are at our core. We put special focus on rare diseases. They are in our origin and in our name: February 29, world day of rare diseases.
f29.t5.2: We want there to be no undiagnosed patients,
f29.t5.3: Can you help us to get it?
f29.t7.2: Those who share our vision and help us make it come true
f29.d3: We envision a time when patients become full and valued partners in collaborative
f29.d4: relationships with health professionals to achieve better health and wellbeing.

policy.t4.2: The data provided by the interested party will be processed by the Foundation for the purpose of carrying out the administrative, economic and fiscal management of the donors, in addition to informing them by any means, including electronic, of any matter related to the fate of donations and the activities of the entity.
policy.t5.2: We will not send you advertising.
policy.t6.2: We will only process your data with your prior consent, which you will be able to provide us with through the corresponding box established for this purpose.
policy.t7.2: In general, only duly authorized personnel of our company may have knowledge of the information we request from you.
policy.t8.2.1: At any time you can contact us to find out what information we hold about you, rectify it if it is incorrect and delete it once our relationship ends, if this is legally possible.
policy.t8.2.2: You also have the right to request the transfer of your information to another entity. This right is called 'portability' and may be useful in certain situations.
policy.t8.2.3: To request any of these rights, you must make a written request to our home address, along with a photocopy of your ID card, so that we can identify you.
policy.t9.1: The Board of Trustees of FUNDACIÓN 29 DE FEBRERO (hereinafter, the data controller), assumes the utmost responsibility and commitment to the establishment, implementation and maintenance of this Data Protection Policy, ensuring continuous improvement of the controller with the aim of achieving excellence in relation to compliance with Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and the free movement of such data and repealing Directive 95/46 / EC (General Data Protection Regulation) (OJEU L 119 / 1. 04-05-2016), and Spanish Personal Data Protection Legislation (Organic Law, specific sectorial legislation and its implementing regulations).
policy.t9.2: The Data Protection Policy of FUNDACIÓN 29 DE FEBRERO is based on the principle of proactive responsibility, according to which the data controller is responsible for compliance with the regulatory and jurisprudential framework that governs said Policy, being able to demonstrate it to the competent authorities.
policy.t9.3: In this regard, the controller shall be governed by the following principles that should serve all staff as a guide and frame of reference in the processing of personal data:
policy.p1: 1. Data protection by design: the controller shall implement, both at the time of determining the means of processing and at the time of the processing itself, appropriate technical and organizational measures, such as pseudonymization, aimed at effectively implementing data protection principles, such as data minimization, and integrating the necessary safeguards in the processing.
policy.p2: 2. Data protection by default: the controller shall implement appropriate technical and organizational measures in order to ensure that, by default, only personal data necessary for each of the specific purposes of the processing are processed.
policy.p3: 3. Data protection in the information lifecycle: the measures ensuring the protection of personal data shall apply throughout the information lifecycle.
policy.p4: 4. Lawfulness, fairness and transparency: personal data shall be processed in a lawful, fair and transparent manner in relation to the data subject.
policy.p5: 5. Purpose limitation: personal data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes, and shall no longer be processed in a way incompatible with those purposes.
policy.p6: 6. Data minimization: personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed.
policy.p7: 7. Accuracy: personal data shall be accurate and, if necessary, kept up to date; All reasonable steps shall be taken to ensure that personal data which are inaccurate in relation to the purposes for which they are processed are erased or rectified without delay.
policy.p8: 8. Limitation of the storage period: personal data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed.
policy.p9: 9. Integrity and confidentiality: personal data shall be processed in such a way as to ensure adequate security of personal data, including protection against unauthorized or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, through the implementation of appropriate technical or organizational measures.
policy.p10: 10. Information and training: one of the keys to ensuring the protection of personal data is the training and information provided to personnel involved in the processing of personal data. During the life cycle of the information, all personnel with access to the data shall be duly trained and informed about their obligations in relation to compliance with data protection regulations.
policy.p11: The Data Protection Policy of FUNDACIÓN 29 DE FEBRERO is communicated to all staff of the data controller and made available to all data subjects.
policy.p12: Consequently, this Data Protection Policy involves all staff of the data controller, who must be aware of it and assume it, considering it as their own, each member being responsible for applying it and verifying the data protection rules applicable to their activity.

terms.title: Terms and conditions
terms.p1: Access to the website of Fundación 29 de Febrero implies acceptance by the user of the rules of use established for it.
terms.p2.1: Access to the site is free of charge and does not generate any commercial, contractual or professional relationship between its users and Fundación 29 de Febrero.
terms.p2.2: The site may contain access to other sites that present personal opinions and other expressions of those who participate in them. Neither the content of these sites, nor the links included from them to other sites are reviewed or monitored by Fundación 29 de Febrero. The text and any other material posted by them express the views of their specific author and do not correspond to the official position of Fundación 29 de Febrero.
terms.p3.1: The user accepts the rules of use of the site, in accordance with the laws in force. Material protected by Intellectual Property laws, or by any other legal right (software, text, graphics, illustrations, photographs, sounds, video and music) may not be used without the express permission of the owner of such material.
terms.p4.1: The user agrees to use the site only for lawful purposes. Fundación 29 de Febrero has the right to remove material from the site, block access or take any other action with respect to posted material at its discretion. The user may not use Fundación 29 de Febrero's computer resources to distribute unsolicited advertising or promotional material of any kind.
terms.p5.1: To it belong the logo, name and all graphics contained in the Fundación 29 de Febrero website. Their use, reproduction, copying or redistribution without the written permission of the Foundation is prohibited. All other trademarks appearing on the site are the property of their respective owners.
terms.p6.1: For any additional questions about our terms and conditions of use of our website, please contact us. We have appointed a DPO who can be contacted at: privacy@foundation29.org
terms.p7.1: The total amount of donations is used for non-profit social purposes. Donations made to Fundación 29 de Febrero are currently subject to tax deduction in Spain, by virtue of the provisions of Law 49/2002, of December 23, 2002, on the tax regime for non-profit entities and tax incentive for patronage.
terms.p7.2: If you reside outside Spain, please consult the withholdings in force for donations to NGOs.

If you wish to exercise your rights or for more information, please visit

footer.Dx29info: Rare Diseases Hub Ukraine is a search and reference tool provided for informational purposes and not intended to replace the clinician’s judgement or experience. It should not be used to diagnose or treat medical conditions.

InfoSystem.titleReload: A new version of Rare Diseases Hub Ukraine is available
InfoSystem.bodyReload: The page will be reloaded automatically to keep you updated

landraito.title: This application connects patients from Ukraine with a rare disease with organizations and hospitals, members of the European Reference Network (ERN), with the aim to provide the specialized medical support they may need during this emergency.
landraito.p1.1: You live in Ukraine or you are a refugee affected by the war in Ukraine.
landraito.p1.2: You have been diagnosed with a rare disease and you need specialized medical support.
landraito.p1.3: You work in a hospital, NGO, patient association or emergency response organisation.
landraito.p1.4: You are in contact with a patient who has been diagnosed with a rare disease or there is a high suspicion he/she has a rare disease.
landraito.t2.1a: Create your account to identify yourself as a patient or doctor.
landraito.t2.2a: Give us some basic information: what you need and where you are.
landraito.t2.3a: The Hub team will process the request together with the ERN and will get in touch to try to give you the aid you may need.
landraito.t3.title: Ways to make a request
landraito.t3.1: Register and fulfill the form to track your request
landraito.t3.3.2: Monday to Friday from 9 am to 5 pm Central European Time
landraito.t4.title: Collaborate with Rare Diseases Hub Ukraine
landraito.t4.1: If you are an organization and you can provide any help to patients with a rare disease, please write an email to
landraito.t4.2: Organizations that are working behind this tool:
landraito.t5.title: Our collaborators
landraito.t6.title: Team

homeraito.t1: Do you belong to a patient organization?
homeraito.t1.1: Thanks, joining a patient organization lets you boost research by aggregating your data with the data of other patients. We will ask you later to see whether you have joined.
homeraito.t2.1: Please, select the organization that better fits with your condition.
homeraito.t2.2: If you can't find one, write down your condition so we can try to engage one for you. This is an initial list that will grow as more associations join. Contact us if you have a suggestion.
homeraito.t2.3: Are you the patient or a caregiver?
homeraito.t3: Do you give us your consent to do so?
homeraito.p1title: Welcome to Rare Diseases Hub Ukraine!
homeraito.p1: This application let's you engage with organizations and hospitals, members of the European Reference Network (ERN), in order to provide the specialized medical support or any other aid you may need related to a rare disease.
homeraito.p1.1: Given the situation, there is no guarantee that your needs can be attended, but communicating them is the first step towards getting the aid you require.

charts.noti1a: Welcome! This is your notification area to see your case status and pending actions.
charts.noti2a: The team is working hard to coordinate with other entities in order to solve your request.

mydata.title: My data
mydata.we will close your session: For your security, we will close your session.
mydata.please enter your password: For security reasons, please enter your password

prereg.title: This is how we manage data
prereg.a1: If you are a patient/caregiver: name, last name, email, phone number, location as provided by the user, disease, birth date of patient, relation with the patient, type of help needed, drugs and dosages, and the messages you send to request drugs and other possible requests such as shelter.
prereg.a2: If you are a physician or professional of an organization: name, last name, email, phone number, location as provided by the user, specialization, center or organization, diagnosis, drugs and dosages of the patient, type of help required, and the messages you send to request clinical advise.
prereg.t2: To whom do we provide your personal data?
prereg.a2.1: The Application does not share personal data with any institution other than the Entity managing your case. The Entity managing your case will have access to your data in order to try to help you try to fulfill your medical needs related to your condition. FUNDACIÓN 29 will not be responsible for the processing of your personal data by the Entity. Once the data is transferred to the Entity by FUNDACIÓN 29, the Entity will be considered the data controller and must provide you with its own privacy policy.
prereg.a2.2: In addition, your personal data may be accessed by FUNDACIÓN 29 service providers in the IT sectors.
prereg.a3: This Application stores all the information you provide at Microsoft Azure Cloud in its West Europe servers, located in the Netherlands.
prereg.a3.1: FUNDACIÓN 29 will only make international transfers outside the European Economic Area if the Entity providing the assistance is located outside the European Economic Area.
prereg.a3.2: FUNDACIÓN 29 will take appropriate safeguards for such international transfer depending on the country in which the Entity is located. You can obtain information on the safeguards adopted by sending an email to: info@sjdhospitalbarcelona.org
prereg.a4: The Application does not share personal data with any institution other than the Entity managing your case. However, the Entity has download and export capabilities. Through this functionality they may extract data to provide you with a better service.
prereg.t6: How long do we keep your personal data?
prereg.a6: Your personal data will be processed until you inform FUNDACIÓN 29 of your wish to cancel your status as a registered user of the Application or 24 months have passed since your last interaction with the Application.
prereg.a6.1: It is your responsibility to keep your personal updated, since they will be used to make communications about the additions, deletions or modifications of accounts registered.

war.statussubtitle: Change the status so that the user knows the evolution of their needs
war.notessubtitle: Notes are for internal use, just for you
war.DrugsNeeds: Drugs and dosage followed by the patient
war.helpdrug: Indicate the active substance and the monthly quantity. You can find this information on the medicine box. If you cannot find it, please contact us.
war.helpdrug2: Click here to see an example.
war.needsSubtitle: Indicate the active compound and the monthly quantity. You can find this information on the drug box. If you can't find it, please reach out to us.
war.needsSubtitle2: Eg: 3 boxes of Clobazam per month
war.Indicates the approximate location: Select your location on the map:
war.titleNoti1: If you need help, write to support office and we will get back to you as soon as possible.
war.titleNoti2: If you have changed the location, you can change it in the patient profile.
war.mandatoryfields: Add at least one drug or write something in the text box to finish.
war.Nedd other2: If there is anything else we could help with, like medical equipment, please let us know.
war.location2: Location does not need to be accurate. It is used to identify needs in specific areas. It is enough to provide location at the neighbourhood or village level.
war.The status of your profile is: The status of your profile is:
war.This is where the patient is currently l: This is where aid is currently needed:
war.These are the drug currently needed: These are the drug currently needed
war.Write the name of your disease: Write the name of your disease
war.nosharelocation: I don't want to say my approximate location
war.optionalLocation: The approximate location has not been added. Click on the map to select it. This is optional.
war.optionalLocation2: The approximate location has not been added. This is optional.
war.titleReferralMedicalCenter: Write the medical center of reference of the patient
war.titleneedAssistance: Type of assistance you are requesting
war.titleneeds: Indicate the type of assistance you need: finding a centre in the EU, medical support for diagnosis, medication adjustment, other assistance.
war.needAssistance: Write the type of assistance you need

physicians.Write what kind of patients you treat: Write what kind of patients you treat
physicians.No needs: You haven't added any needs yet, click 'New Need' to get started.

sampleDrug.id2: The active compound is a substance in a medication that does the intended pharmacological activity of the drug. Different commercial products may have the same purposes and active compund. Communicating the active compund makes it easier to organize help.
sampleDrug.id4: You can find it by searching on the internet or on the product box. For instance, in the image below, the drug name is Pretendmed and the active compound is fauxpharmoide. The active compound is also called the generic name.

adminRole.title: Administration view for
adminRole.subtitle: This admin let's you locate and communicate with patients and physicians (users) in need of aid. You can export the data for easier collaboration with other entities.
adminRole.subtitle1: This is the approximate location of your users. Click on the pins to view detailed information.
adminRole.subtitle2: This list allows let's you get details on each case. Clicking on the pin will locate them on the map. The column titles are actionable to sort the table.
adminRole.noti1: Notify me by email when a new user signs up
adminRole.noti2: Notify me by email when a user changes their request

legal.title: Legal Notice
legal.p1.1: For the effects of Article 10 of Law 34/2002, of 11th July, on Information Society and Electronic Commerce Services (LSSICE), the user is informed that the website owner is SJD Barcelona Children’s Hospital, with registered office at Passeig Sant Joan de Déu no. 2., 08950, Esplugues de Llobregat (Barcelona province); holder of VAT no. R-5800645-C and with e-mail address info@sjdhospitalbarcelona.org. It is registered in the Register of Religious Entities of the Ministry of Justice under number 1188-C/1-SE/B.
legal.p1.2: Any person accessing this website assumes the status of user, undertaking to strictly observe and comply with the rules set out herein, as well as with any other applicable provisions of law.
legal.p1.3: The website owner reserves the right to change any type of information that may appear on the website, without any obligation to notify or to make known to users such changes, and it is understood to suffice for the website owner to publish the changes on the website.
legal.t2: Trusted third party and code of conduct
legal.p2.1: The website owner adheres to the Catalan Union of Hospitals standard code of conduct.
legal.p3.1: The website owner declines all liability derived from the information published on its website insofar as such information were to have been handled or entered by any third person not belonging to its organisation.
legal.p3.2: It is possible that the user may be redirected from the website to the contents of third-person websites. Since the website owner cannot always control the contents entered by third persons on their respective websites, the website owner declines all liability with respect to such contents. In any case, the website owner states that it will proceed to the immediate withdrawal of any content that may contravene national or international law, morals or public order, immediately removing the link to any such website and making the respective content known to the competent authorities.
legal.p3.3: The website owner declines all liability for the information and contents stored in spaces including, without limitation, forums, chatrooms, blog generators, commentaries, social networks or any other medium that allows third persons to publish contents independently on the website of the website owner. Notwithstanding, in compliance with the provisions of Articles 11 and 16 of the LSSICE, the website owner places itself at the disposal of all users, authorities and security forces, and will cooperate actively on the removal or, as appropriate, blocking of all the contents that may affect or contravene national or international law, the rights of third persons or morals and public order. In the event in which the user were to consider that there is any content on the website that may be subject to such consideration, he is requested to make it immediately known to the website administrator.
legal.p4.1: The purpose of this website is to connect patients from Ukraine with a rare disease with organizations and hospitals, members of the European Reference Network (ERN), with the aim to provide the specialized medical support they may need. SJD Barcelona Children’s Hospital reserves the right to make, at any time and without prior notice, changes in the contents and presentation of its website.
legal.p4.2: The information contained on this website is of informative nature alone and does not seek under any circumstances to replace professional medical advice. None of the contents published on this website, whether they are fixed contents or comments of the administrating team of the website, have the purpose of being used for medical diagnosis or treatment or as a second medical opinion. Consequently, the Hospital declines all liability with respect to the inappropriate use of the contents of its website.
legal.p5.1: The website owner makes links available to users in order to facilitate the search for and access to information, services and other pertinent contents available on the Internet. The links provided on this website may lead the user to other websites and pages managed by third persons, on which the website owner exercises no control whatsoever.
legal.p5.2: The website owner declines any duty of supervising or verifying the information or contents of the other websites which the user may access by means of the hyperlinks found on the Hospital’s website. The website owner assumes, exclusively, the duty to remove from the website, in the shortest possible delay, the information, contents or services that do not reflect reality or that may be misleading or cause harm to the user.
legal.p6.1: All operating rights are reserved. This website is governed by Spanish law and it is protected by the national and international law on intellectual and industrial property.
legal.p6.2: Regardless of the purpose for which the contents of the website are intended, the total or partial reproduction, use, operation, distribution and commercialisation of it require in all cases the prior written consent of SJD Barcelona Children’s Hospital as the owner of the website. Any use not previously consented by SJD Barcelona Children’s Hospital will be considered a serious breach of the author’s intellectual and industrial property rights.
legal.p6.3: The designs, logotypes, texts and/or graphics not belonging to the website owner which may appear on the website belong to their respective owners, and the latter are responsible for any controversy which may arise with respect to same.
legal.p6.4: The website owner acknowledges the respective intellectual and industrial property rights of the holders of same, and the mere mention or appearance of whatever contents on the website does not entail the existence of rights or responsibilities of the website owner in relation to same, or support, sponsorship or recommendation of it by the website owner.
legal.p6.5: The website owner also expresses its acknowledgement of the Internet sources from which it has obtained some of the images that illustrate the contents of the website, and the references of it are set out wherever possible. We believe that these images may help decisively to more clearly convey the knowledge of the rare diseases from our standpoint to society.
legal.p6.6: The user of the website should refrain in all cases from removing, altering, eluding or manipulating any protective device or security system that may be installed in the website.Any remarks with respect to possible breaches of intellectual or industrial property rights and in relation to any of the contents of the website may be notified to the following e-mail address:
legal.p7.1: For the settlement of any controversies or other matters relating to the website or to the activities carried out on it, Spanish law will be applicable and the parties expressly submit themselves to it. The courts and tribunals of Barcelona, Spain, are competent for the resolution of all conflicts deriving from or relating to the use of the website.

cookies.title: Cookies policy
cookies.p1.1: The Foundation 29 recognises the importance of the applicable legislation and regulations pertaining to privacy and data protection. In this sense, the protection of the safety, integrity and confidentiality of our clients' and users' information is very important to us and we therefore strive to act responsibly in this regard. This page describes our web’s (hereinafter, the web) cookies policy http://www.foundation29.org (hereinafter the web).
cookies.p1.2: The provisions of both the Legal Notice and the Privacy policy will apply for the purpose of this Cookies Policy.
cookies.p2.1: As specified in the first layer ('banner on cookies'), the User has accepted or is able to accept this Cookies Policy. The use of technical means to prevent cookies from being downloaded to the user's browser does not invalidate the consent given for legal purposes, although the technical result may be that some or none of the cookies will not be downloaded, the effects of which are described later in this Cookies Policy.
cookies.p3.1: Foundation 29 uses cookies to make the browsing of its web more functional and useful for its users. In this sense, and to give the User all the information necessary for correct browsing, we provide the following explanatory text on what cookies are and how the User can disable them.
cookies.p4.1: All websites (regardless of the service they provide) currently use cookies, i.e. they save minimal information about the User’s activity on the website. A cookie can therefore be defined as a small text file or generalised device downloaded onto the User’s device or machine when they are browsing websites with the aim of storing data that may be updated and retrieved by the organisation responsible for their installation.
cookies.t5: 5. Purposes, management of cookies and type of cookies
cookies.p5.1: Technical cookies: These cookies allow the User to browse a web page, platform or application and to use the different options or services provided, such as monitoring traffic and data reporting, identification of session, access to restricted sections, using safety features during browsing, storing content for the streaming of videos or sound or sharing content via the social media.
cookies.p5.2: Analytical cookies: These cookies allow the person responsible for them to monitor and analyse the behaviour of users on the websites to which they are linked. The information collected through this type of cookies is used to measure the activity of the websites, application or platform and to generate browsing profiles of the users of these sites, applications and platforms in order to make improvements based on the analysis of the usage data of the users of the service.
cookies.p5.2.1: Google Analytics: it used to distinguish users.
cookies.p5.2.2: Hotjar: it is used to record the user's navigation through the elements of the web.
cookies.p5.3: The web does not use personalization cookies, advertising cookies or behavioral advertising cookies.
cookies.p6.1: Users can disable cookies from the preferences section on their Internet browser. Here are some links provided by the most popular browsers, with instructions for managing cookies on different devices and versions, if required.

cookie.message: This Application uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our Application.
